revised_title: Overcoming Shock Attenuation in Shock Tubes Using Detonating Driver Gases
tldr: This article explores two experimental conditions to overcome the attenuation of shocks in shock tubes using detonating driver gases. The authors investigate a double-diaphragm shock tube with unheated hydrogen as the driver gas and a detonable gas in the middle section. They find that detonation conditions can be optimized to produce uniformly driven shocks, which can be useful for high-temperature gas research and studying gas dynamics.
